condition.details: Refinished. Reupholstered. Wear consistent with age and use. Minor structural damages.

specifications.rawSpecificationsHTML: Pair of first edition "Partfall" armchairs created by Philippe Starck in 1983 and produced by Driade, a renowned Italian furniture manufacturer. Designed for a space conducive to meditation in the private quarters of the Élysée Palace for the incumbent President of the French Republic, Francois Mitterrand. Cutting-edge design the chair has only three legs! It is a large version of the classic 'Costes' model dining chairs designed for the Café costes in Paris. features a tripod black enameled steel frame, the shell is made of high-gloss black lacquered curved plywood, seat is padded and covered with high-quality black leather. Sold as a pair or separately. Single chair available in seperate listing Reference Number: LU4528223524262 Philippe Starck is a French industrial architect and designer. He was the Art Director of the Pierre Cardin studio in 1969 where he designed 65 pieces of furniture. The Pratfall chair is a universal design icon that marked the beginning of the successful collaboration between Philippe Starck and Driade. Literature: Philippe, Simone, ed. Starck. Cologne: Taschen, 2000.
